title: (x) Pharoah Sanders "Karma" late 60s album art - Shalom {Mike Y}
content:
This is probably done by hand (?), but what type will get me close to this? This dates from the late 60s.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [karma.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410204859/http:/typophile.com/files/karma.jpg) | 47.61 KB |

 [‹ EIGENSTATE! I NEED THIS FONT UNBELIEVABLY BAD!](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410204859/http:/typophile.com/node/19607 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Bristol Uni "physics" website banner - ITC Eras {Matthew B} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410204859/http:/typophile.com/node/19611 "Go to next forum topic")
author: green_child

comments.content:
This resembles a film type called ’Shalom’ shown in the Solotype Catalog (p.74). I found a digital version of something like it [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410204859/http:/www.dafont.com/ds-sholom.font).

- Mike Yanega
Thank you Mike. Sholom is maybe the closest I will get for now.

Hmmm...

Shalom is designed to look like the Hebrew alphabet, but the Pharoah Sanders album doesn’t look like that at all.

Not that I can find anything closer, of course...
